field.documentation: Name of the actual data provider (the person who filled the data)

field.name: putdate
field.documentation: Date at which the data has been put in the DB

field.name: source
field.documentation: Exact reference of the data source (e.g. original reference in the native machine data base)

field.name: comment
field.documentation: Any additional comment

field.name: isref
field.documentation: 1 if the data can be found in the present data base entry; 2 if the data can be found in a parent data base entry; 0 if no data consistent with the present entry can be found.

field.name: whatref
field.documentation: Structure defining a database entry and the CPO occurrence

field.name: user
field.documentation: Name of the user if private data, public if public ITM database.

field.name: machine
field.documentation: Name of the device

field.name: shot
field.documentation: Shot number

field.name: run
field.documentation: Run number

field.name: occurrence
field.documentation: Occurrence number of the CPO in the reference entry

field.name: putinfo
field.documentation: Level 2 information describing how to retrieve the actual data for the UAL. Not to be filled/used by the ITM user !

field.name: putmethod
field.documentation: Storage method for this data

field.name: putaccess
field.documentation: Instructions to access the data using this method

field.name: putlocation
field.documentation: Name of this data under this method

field.name: rights
field.documentation: Access rights to this data

field.name: composition
field.documentation: Plasma composition (description of ion species).

field.name: amn
field.documentation: Atomic mass number (lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: zn
field.documentation: Nuclear charge (lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: zion
field.documentation: Ion charge (of the dominant ionisation state; lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: imp_flag
field.documentation: Multiple charge state calculation flag : 0-Only one charge state is considered; 1-Multiple charge state are considered and are described in impurity CPO; Vector (nion)

field.name: distri_vec
field.documentation: Vector over all distribution functions; Time-dependent. Structure array(ndist_spec)

field.name: calc_spec
field.documentation: Pointer to the species for which the distribution function(s) is/are calculated and whose characteristics are given in composition (for ions). Value 0 means electrons.

field.name: nucl_reac
field.documentation: Information on nuclear reactions involving the calculated species.

field.name: point_reac
field.documentation: Pointer to a species in composition who can undergo a nuclear reaction with the calculated species; Vector (nreac)

field.name: id_reac
field.documentation: Identification of the reaction between the calculated species and a background species (including which branch if applicable); Time-dependent; Vector (nreac). Table defining the index of reactions to be provided.

field.name: global_param
field.documentation: Global parameters (in most cases volume integrated and surface averaged quanatities).

field.name: enrg
field.documentation: Energy content of of a distribution species [J]; Time-dependent

field.name: enrg_para
field.documentation: Parallel energy content of of a distribution species [J]; Time-dependent

field.name: pow_coll_i
field.documentation: Collisional power to ions [W]; Time-dependent; Matrix(nion)

field.name: pow_coll_e
field.documentation: Collisional power to the electrons [W]; Time-dependent

field.name: therm_src
field.documentation: Source particles and power due to particles of the distribution species being thermalised (merging into the thermal plasma).

field.name: particles
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [1/s]; Time-dependedent

field.name: power
field.documentation: Power associated with the source/sink of particles [W]; Time-dependent

field.name: torque
field.documentation: Torque due to the source/sink of particles [N.m]; Time-dependent

field.name: losses
field.documentation: Losses of the distribution species (orbit losses and neutralisation losses).

field.name: orb_loss
field.documentation: Losses due to orbits intersecting a material surface.

field.name: particles
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [1/s]; Time-dependedent

field.name: power
field.documentation: Power associated with the source/sink of particles [W]; Time-dependent

field.name: torque
field.documentation: Torque due to the source/sink of particles [N.m]; Time-dependent

field.name: neutr_loss
field.documentation: Losses due to neutralisation of distribution ions (charge exchange etc.)

field.name: particles
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [1/s]; Time-dependedent

field.name: power
field.documentation: Power associated with the source/sink of particles [W]; Time-dependent

field.name: torque
field.documentation: Torque due to the source/sink of particles [N.m]; Time-dependent

field.name: cur_dr_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal current of non-thermal particles (excluding electron back current for fast ions) [A]; Time-dependent.

field.name: trq_i
field.documentation: Collisional torque to background ions [N.m]; Time-dependent; Vector (nion)

field.name: trq_e
field.documentation: Collisional torque to electrons [N.m]; Time-dependent

field.name: trq_j_rxb
field.documentation: Torque due to radial currents of non-thermal particles [N.m]; Time-dependent.

field.name: nucl_reac_th
field.documentation: Nuclear reactions between the calculated species and other species assumed to have thermal distributions.

field.name: rate
field.documentation: Reaction rate [1/s]; Time-dependent; Vector (nreac)

field.name: power
field.documentation: Fusion reaction power[W]; Time-dependent; Vector (nreac)

field.name: nucl_reac_sf
field.documentation: Nuclear reactions of the calculated species with itself (thermal + non-thermal).

field.name: rate
field.documentation: Reaction rate [1/s]; Time-dependent

field.name: power
field.documentation: Fusion reaction power[W]; Time-dependent

field.name: profiles_1d
field.documentation: Profiles (volume integrated and flux surface averaged)

field.name: npsi
field.documentation: Number of points of the radial grid for each species.

field.name: rho_tor_norm
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal flux coordinate at the grid points for 1D profiles; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: rho_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate at the grid points for 1D profiles [m]. Defined as sqrt(phi/pi/B0), where B0 = equilibrium/global_param/toroid_field/b0. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: psi
field.documentation: Poloidal flux at the grid points for 1D profiles [Wb], without 1/2pi and such that Bp=|grad psi| /R/2/pi. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: enrgd_tot
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged energy density of a distribution species [J/m^3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: enrgd_para
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged parallel energy density of a distribution species [J/m^3] Time-dependent; Vector (npsi).

field.name: powd_coll_i
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional power to ions [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Matrix (nion, npsi)

field.name: powd_coll_e
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional power to the electrons [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Vector(npsi)

field.name: therm_srcd
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged source of particles and power due to particles of the distribution species being thermalised (merging into the thermal plasma).

field.name: particlesd
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [s^-1 m^-3]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: powerd
field.documentation: Power density associated with the source/sink of particles [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: torqued
field.documentation: Torque density due to the source/sink of particles [N.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: lossesd
field.documentation: Particle loss densities due to charge exchange events with neutrals or orbits intersecting material surfaces.

field.name: orb_loss
field.documentation: Losses due to orbits intersecting a material surface.

field.name: particlesd
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [s^-1 m^-3]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: powerd
field.documentation: Power density associated with the source/sink of particles [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: torqued
field.documentation: Torque density due to the source/sink of particles [N.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: neutr_loss
field.documentation: Losses due to neutralised ions, e.g. due to charge exchange events.

field.name: particlesd
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [s^-1 m^-3]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: powerd
field.documentation: Power density associated with the source/sink of particles [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: torqued
field.documentation: Torque density due to the source/sink of particles [N.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: curd_fp
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged toroidal current density of non-thermal (fast) particles of the distribution species (excluding electron back current for fast ions) [A.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi).

field.name: curd_dr
field.documentation: Total toroidal driven current density (including electron back current in the presence of fast ions) [A]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: trqd_i
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional toroidal torque to background ions [N.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Matrix (nion, npsi)

field.name: trqd_e
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional toroidal torque density to electrons [N.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: trqd_jrxb
field.documentation: Toroidal torque density due to radial currents of non-thermal particles of the distribution species [N.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: nucl_rd_th
field.documentation: Nuclear reaction rate densities for reactions between the cacluated species and other species assumed to have thermal distributions.

field.name: rated
field.documentation: Reaction rate [s^-1.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Matrix (nreac, max_npsi)

field.name: powerd
field.documentation: Nuclear reaction power density [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Matrix (nreac, max_npsi)

field.name: nucl_rd_sf
field.documentation: Nuclear reaction rate densities for reactions of the calculated species with itself (thermal + non-thermal).

field.name: rate
field.documentation: Reaction rate [s^-1.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Matrix (npsi)

field.name: power
field.documentation: Fusion reaction power [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Matrix (npsi)

field.name: enrg_tot
field.documentation: Energy content of of a distribution species [J] inside a flux surface; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: enrg_para
field.documentation: Parallel energy content of a distribution species [J] inside a flux surface; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: pow_coll_i
field.documentation: Collisional power to ions inside a flux surface [W]; Time-dependent; Matrix(nion, npsi)

field.name: pow_coll_e
field.documentation: Collisional power to the electrons inside a flux surface [W]; Time-dependent; Vector(npsi)

field.name: therm_src
field.documentation: Source particles and power inside a flux surface due to particles of the distribution species being thermalised (merging into the thermal plasma).

field.name: particles
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [1/s]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: power
field.documentation: Power associated with the source/sink of particles [W]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: torque
field.documentation: Torque due to the source/sink of particles [N.m]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: losses
field.documentation: Particle loss inside flux surface due to charge exchange events.

field.name: orb_loss
field.documentation: Losses due to orbits intersecting a material surface.

field.name: particles
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [1/s]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: power
field.documentation: Power associated with the source/sink of particles [W]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: torque
field.documentation: Torque due to the source/sink of particles [N.m]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: neutr_loss
field.documentation: Losses due to neutralised ions, e.g. due to charge exchange events.

field.name: particles
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [1/s]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: power
field.documentation: Power associated with the source/sink of particles [W]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: torque
field.documentation: Torque due to the source/sink of particles [N.m]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: cur_fp
field.documentation: Toroidal current of non-thermal (fast) particles driven inside a flux surface (does not include electron back current for fast ions) [A]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: cur_dr
field.documentation: Total toroidal current driven inside a flux surface (including electron back current in the presence of fast ions) [A]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi).

field.name: trq_i
field.documentation: Collisional toroidal torque to background ions inside a flux surface [N.m]; Time-dependent; Matrix (nion, npsi)

field.name: trq_e
field.documentation: Collisional toroidal torque to electrons inside a flux surface [N.m]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: trq_j_rxb
field.documentation: Toroidal torque due to radial currents of non-thermal particles of the distribution species [N.m]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: nucl_reac_th
field.documentation: Nuclear reactions inside a flux surface involving the distribution species and other species assumed to be thermal.

field.name: rate
field.documentation: Reaction rate [1/s]; Time-dependent; Matrix (nreac, npsi)

field.name: power
field.documentation: Fusion reaction power[W]; Time-dependent; Matrix (nreac, npsi)

field.name: nucl_reac_sf
field.documentation: Nuclear reactions inside a flux surface of the calculated species with itself (thermal + non-thermal).

field.name: rate
field.documentation: Reaction rate [1/s]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: power
field.documentation: Fusion reaction power[W]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: dist_func
field.documentation: Distribution functions. The total distribution total distribution can either be given by the a set of markers/test particles (in markers), or by a gridded function (dist_expand). Note that the gridded distribution can be written as sum of successive approximations, where each term is given by an element in the vector dist_expand. Finally, the distribution can be written as a sum of a marker distribution and a gridded distribution, e.g. for delta-f Monte Carlo solution.

field.name: markers
field.documentation: Distribution given as a set of test particles, or markers.

field.name: nvar
field.documentation: Number of variables associated with a marker (test particle)

field.name: var_id
field.documentation: Identification of phase space variables. var_id(K) describe the variable represented in varK, for K=1,2...7. The possible variables are: 1=R, Major radius [m]; 2=Z, Vertical position [m]; 3=X, first cartesian coordinate in the horizontal plane [m]; 4=Y, second cartesian coordinate in the horizontal plane (grad(X) x grad(Y) = grad(Z)) [m]; 5=phi, toroidal angle [rad]; 6=psi, poloidal magnetic flux [T/m^2]; 7=rhotor, the square root of the toroidal flux; 8=theta, geometrical poloidal angle [rad]; 9=theta_b, Boozer poloidal angle [rad]; 10=vx, velocity in the x-direction [m/s]; 11=vy, velocity in the y-direction [m/s]; 12=vz, velocity in the z-direction [m/s]; 13=vel, total velocity [m/s]; 14=vphi, velocity in the phi-direction [m/s]; 15=vpar, velocity in the parallel direction [m/s]; 16=vperp, velocity in the perpendicular direction [m/s]; 17=E, Hamiltonian energy [J]; 18=Pphi, canonical toroidal angular momentum [kg m^2/s]; 19=mu, magnetic moment [J/T]; 20=Lambda=mu/E [1/T]; 21=pitch=vpar/v [-]; 22=s, the position of the omnigenous plane (generalised equitorial plane) as described by the fields omnigen_surf%s and omnigen_surf%rz; 23=particle spin. Vector (7)

field.name: var1
field.documentation: Phase space variables one characterising the markers; Time-dependent; Vector (ntpart)

field.name: var2
field.documentation: Phase space variables two characterising the markers; Time-dependent; Vector (ntpart)

field.name: var3
field.documentation: Phase space variables three characterising the markers; Time-dependent; Vector (ntpart)

field.name: var4
field.documentation: Phase space variables four characterising the markers; Time-dependent; Vector (ntpart)

field.name: var5
field.documentation: Phase space variables five characterising the markers; Time-dependent; Vector (ntpart)

field.name: var6
field.documentation: Phase space variables six characterising the markers; Time-dependent; Vector (ntpart)

field.name: var7
field.documentation: Phase space variables seven characterising the markers; Time-dependent; Vector (ntpart)

field.name: weight
field.documentation: Weight of the markers; Time-dependent; Vector (ntpart)

field.name: f_expansion
field.documentation: Distribution function, f, expanded into a vector of successive approximations. The first element in the vector (f_expansion(1)) is the zeroth order distribution function, while the K:th elemnet in the vector (f_expansion(K)) is the K:th correction, such that the total distribution function is a sum over all elements in the f_expansion vector. Time-dependent. Structure array(Nf_expansion)

field.name: grid_info
field.documentation: Specification of grids used in topo_regions. Grid coordinates could either be invariants of motion, or information at single point along orbit, e.g. xi and s for grid_coord=3. This point should always be on a so-called omnigenous surface (a generalised equitorial plane); grad(psi) x grad(B) = 0. All closed orbits cross omnigenous surfaces at least two times. The omnigenous surfaces are described in omnigen_surf.

field.name: grid_type
field.documentation: Type of grid: 1=unstructured grid; 2=structured non-rectangular grid, here ndim11=ndim12=ndim13, ndim21=ndim22=ndim23, ndim31=ndim32=ndim33; 3=rectangular grid, where grid coordinates are stored in the vectors dim1(1:ndim1,1,1), dim2(1,1:ndim2,1), dim3(1,1,1:ndim3)

field.name: ngriddim
field.documentation: Number of grid dimension. For ngriddim=2 the grid is specified by dim1 and dim2 only, while dim3, dim4, dim5, dim6 can be ignored (should not be allocated). For ngriddim=3 also dim3 is used to describe the grid etc. E.g. if your distribution is given by the three variables the poloidal flux, perpendicular and parallel velocities, then ngriddim=3 and grid_coord(1)=15, grid_coord(1)=16, grid_coord(3)=6.

field.name: grid_coord
field.documentation: Identifies the coordinates specifies in dim1, dim2, dim3, dim4, dim5, and dim6. grid_coord(K) describes the coordinate representaed in dimK, for K=1,2...6. The possible coordinates are: 1=R, Major radius [m]; 2=Z, Vertical position [m]; 3=X, first cartesian coordinate in the horizontal plane [m]; 4=Y, second cartesian coordinate in the horizontal plane (grad(X) x grad(Y) = grad(Z)) [m]; 5=phi, toroidal angle [rad]; 6=psi, poloidal magnetic flux [T/m^2]; 7=rhotor, the square root of the toroidal flux; 8=theta, geometrical poloidal angle [rad]; 9=theta_b, Boozer poloidal angle [rad]; 10=vx, velocity in the x-direction [m/s]; 11=vy, velocity in the y-direction [m/s]; 12=vz, velocity in the z-direction [m/s]; 13=vel, total velocity [m/s]; 14=vphi, velocity in the phi-direction [m/s]; 15=vpar, velocity in the parallel direction [m/s]; 16=vperp, velocity in the perpendicular direction [m/s]; 17=E, Hamiltonian energy [J]; 18=Pphi, canonical toroidal angular momentum [kg m^2/s]; 19=mu, magnetic moment [J/T]; 20=Lambda=mu/E [1/T]; 21=pitch=vpar/v [-]; 22=s, the position of the omnigenous plane (generalised equitorial plane) as described by the fields omnigen_surf%s and omnigen_surf%rz; 23=particle spin; 24=n_Legendre, the index of the Legendre polynomial of the pitch, e.g. if the k:th component of dim3(1,1,k,1,1,1)=5 then this refer to the 5:th Legendre polynomial P_5(xi). Vector (6)

field.name: thin_orbits
field.documentation: Specifies if guiding centre orbits are thin. Note: only used for orbit averaged distribution functions. For thin_orbits=1 the orbit are considered thin, i.e. each orbit is bound to follow a single flux surface; for thin_orbits=0 the orbits are asumed to follow guiding centre trajectories. E.g. thin_orbits=0 using constants of motion as given in a generalised equitorial plane, then the orbit outside the equitorial plane are described by the guiding centre equations of motion.

field.name: topology
field.documentation: Description of the topology of the grid. NOTE: only used for nregion_topo>2.

field.name: omnigen_surf
field.documentation: List of omnigeuous magnetic surfaces to which the s-coordinates in grid_coord refer. NOTE: only used for gridcoord=3. NOTE: all guiding centre orbits intersect at least one omnigeuous (or stagnation) surfaces, i.e. the omnigeuous generalised the equitorial plane (the midplane). nsurfs=Number of omnigenous surfaces. Structure array(nregion_topo)

field.name: rz
field.documentation: (R,z) coordinates of the omnigeuous magnetic surfaces (generalised equitorial plane). NOTE: only used for gridcoord=3. Vector rz1d (nsurfs)

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: s
field.documentation: Coordinates which uniquely maps the omnigeuous magnetic surfaces (generalised equitorial plane). NOTE: only used for gridcoord=3. Vector (nsurfs)

field.name: topo_regions
field.documentation: List with distribution function in each topological region; Time-dependent. Structure array(nregion_topo)

field.name: ind_omnigen
field.documentation: Index of the omnigeuous magnetic surfaces (generalised equitorial plane) to which the s-coordinates refer. NOTE: only used for gridcoord=3.

field.name: dim1
field.documentation: First dimension in phase space; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim11, ndim21, ndim31, ndim41, ndim51, ndim61).

field.name: dim2
field.documentation: Second dimension in phase space; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim12, ndim22, ndim32, ndim42, ndim52, ndim62).

field.name: dim3
field.documentation: Third dimension in phase space; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim13, ndim23, ndim33, ndim43, ndim53, ndim63).

field.name: dim4
field.documentation: Fourth dimension in phase space; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim14, ndim24, ndim34, ndim44, ndim54, ndim64).

field.name: dim5
field.documentation: Fifth dimension in phase space; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim15, ndim25, ndim35, ndim45, ndim55, ndim65).

field.name: dim6
field.documentation: Sixth dimension in phase space; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim16, ndim26, ndim36, ndim46, ndim56, ndim66).

field.name: jacobian
field.documentation: Jacobian of the transformation of the phase space grid variables; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim11, ndim22, ndim33, ndim44, ndim55, ndim66).

field.name: distfunc
field.documentation: Orbit (or bounce) averaged distribution function given on a grid [1/m^3 (m/s)^-3]; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim11, ndim22, ndim33, ndim44, ndim55, ndim66).

field.name: input_src
field.documentation: Input sources of particles and power for the distribution species (to aid diagnosing the code output).

field.name: particle_src
field.documentation: Particle source

field.name: total
field.documentation: Total source of particles and power (NBI, fusion products, pellets etc.)

field.name: particles
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [1/s]; Time-dependedent

field.name: power
field.documentation: Power associated with the source/sink of particles [W]; Time-dependent

field.name: torque
field.documentation: Torque due to the source/sink of particles [N.m]; Time-dependent

field.name: volume_intgr
field.documentation: Volume integrated source of particles and power (NBI, fusion products, pellets etc.)

field.name: particles
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [1/s]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: power
field.documentation: Power associated with the source/sink of particles [W]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: torque
field.documentation: Torque due to the source/sink of particles [N.m]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: flux_surf_av
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged source of particles and power (NBI, fusion products, pellets etc.)

field.name: particlesd
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [s^-1 m^-3]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: powerd
field.documentation: Power density associated with the source/sink of particles [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: torqued
field.documentation: Torque density due to the source/sink of particles [N.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: wave_src
field.documentation: Auxiliary wave absorbed by the distribution species

field.name: type
field.documentation: Wave type (LH, EC, IC, ...), can be a combination of these if several wave types are absorbed by this species.

field.name: wave_power
field.documentation: Auxiliary wave power absorbed by the distribution species [W]; Time-dependent.

field.name: wave_powerd
field.documentation: Auxiliary flux surface averaged wave power density absorbed by the distribution species [W/m^3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: codeparam
field.documentation: Code parameters

field.name: codename
field.documentation: Name of the code

field.name: codeversion
field.documentation: Version of the code (as in the ITM repository)

field.name: parameters
field.documentation: List of the code specific parameters, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_diag
field.documentation: List of the code specific diagnostic/output, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_flag
field.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values meaning some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used. Exact rules could discussed and implemented in the module wrapper. Time-dependent.

field.name: codeparam
field.documentation: Code parameters

field.documentation: Name of the code

field.name: codeversion
field.documentation: Version of the code (as in the ITM repository)

Negative values mean the result shall not be used. Exact rules could discussed and implemented in the module wrapper. Time-dependent.

field.name: time
field.documentation: Time [s]; Time-dependent; Scalar

CPO.documentation: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Time-dependent CPO

field.name: datainfo
field.documentation: Generic information on a data item

field.name: dataprovider
field.documentation: Name of the actual data provider (the person who filled the data)

field.name: putdate
field.documentation: Date at which the data has been put in the DB

field.name: source
field.documentation: Exact reference of the data source (e.g. original reference in the native machine data base)

field.name: comment
field.documentation: Any additional comment

field.name: isref
field.documentation: 1 if the data can be found in the present data base entry; 2 if the data can be found in a parent data base entry; 0 if no data consistent with the present entry can be found.

field.name: whatref
field.documentation: Structure defining a database entry and the CPO occurrence

field.name: user
field.documentation: Name of the user if private data, public if public ITM database.

field.name: machine
field.documentation: Name of the device

field.name: shot
field.documentation: Shot number

field.name: run
field.documentation: Run number

field.name: occurrence
field.documentation: Occurrence number of the CPO in the reference entry

field.name: putinfo
field.documentation: Level 2 information describing how to retrieve the actual data for the UAL. Not to be filled/used by the ITM user !

field.name: putmethod
field.documentation: Storage method for this data

field.name: putaccess
field.documentation: Instructions to access the data using this method

field.name: putlocation
field.documentation: Name of this data under this method

field.name: rights
field.documentation: Access rights to this data

field.name: composition
field.documentation: Plasma composition (description of ion species).

field.name: amn
field.documentation: Atomic mass number (lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: zn
field.documentation: Nuclear charge (lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: zion
field.documentation: Ion charge (of the dominant ionisation state; lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: imp_flag
field.documentation: Multiple charge state calculation flag : 0-Only one charge state is considered; 1-Multiple charge state are considered and are described in impurity CPO; Vector (nion)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source. Time-dependent. Structure array(nsrc_spec)

field.name: src_spec
field.documentation: Pointer to the source species whose characteristics are given in composition.

field.name: global_param
field.documentation: Global parameters.

field.name: src_pow
field.documentation: Total power source [W]; Time-dependent.

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: abserror
field.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: relerror
field.documentation: Relative error on signal (normalised to signal value); Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: src_rate
field.documentation: Particle source rate [1/s]; Time-dependent.

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: abserror
field.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: relerror
field.documentation: Relative error on signal (normalised to signal value); Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: profiles_1d
field.documentation: 1D radial profiles

field.name: rho_tor_norm
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal flux coordinate at the grid points for 1D profiles; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: rho_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate at the grid points for 1D profiles [m]. Defined as sqrt(phi/pi/B0), where B0 = equilibrium/global_param/toroid_field/b0. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: psi
field.documentation: Poloidal flux at the grid points for 1D profiles [Wb], without 1/2pi and such that Bp=|grad psi| /R/2/pi. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: pow_den
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged power density [W/m^3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Vector

field.name: abserror
field.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Vector

field.name: relerror
field.documentation: Relative error on signal (normalised to signal value); Time-dependent; Vector

field.name: src_rate
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged total source density of particles [m^-3 s^-1]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Vector

field.name: abserror
field.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Vector

field.name: relerror
field.documentation: Relative error on signal (normalised to signal value); Time-dependent; Vector

field.name: profiles_2d
field.documentation: 2D source profiles in terms of two phase space coordinates

field.name: grid_coord
field.documentation: Identifies the coordinates specifies in dim1 and dim2. grid_coord(1) and grid_coord(2) describe the coordinate represented in dim1 and dim2. The possible coordinates are: 1=R, Major radius [m]; 2=Z, Vertical position [m]; 3=X, first cartesian coordinate in the horizontal plane [m]; 4=Y, second cartesian coordinate in the horizontal plane (grad(X) x grad(Y) = grad(Z)) [m]; 5=phi, toroidal angle [rad]; 6=psi, poloidal magnetic flux [T/m^2]; 7=rhotor, the square root of the toroidal flux; 8=theta, geometrical poloidal angle [rad]; 9=theta_b, Boozer poloidal angle [rad]; 10=vx, velocity in the x-direction [m/s]; 11=vy, velocity in the y-direction [m/s]; 12=vz, velocity in the z-direction [m/s]; 13=vel, total velocity [m/s]; 14=vphi, velocity in the phi-direction [m/s]; 15=vpar, velocity in the parallel direction [m/s]; 16=vperp, velocity in the perpendicular direction [m/s]; 17=E, Hamiltonian energy [J]; 18=Pphi, canonical toroidal angular momentum [kg m^2/s]; 19=mu, magnetic moment [J/T]; 20=Lambda=mu/E [1/T]. Vector (2)

field.name: dim1
field.documentation: First coordinate of 2D grid. Time-dependent; Vector (ndim1,ndim2)

field.name: dim2
field.documentation: Second coordinate of 2D grid. Time-dependent; Vector (ndim1,ndim2)

field.name: g11
field.documentation: 11 component of the covariant metric tensor in the (dim1, dim2) coordiante system. Time-dependent; Vector (ndim1,ndim2)

field.name: g12
field.documentation: 12 component of the covariant metric tensor in the (dim1, dim2) coordiante system. Time-dependent; Vector (ndim1,ndim2)

field.name: g21
field.documentation: 21 component of the covariant metric tensor in the (dim1, dim2) coordiante system. Time-dependent; Vector (ndim1,ndim2)

field.name: g22
field.documentation: 22 component of the covariant metric tensor in the (dim1, dim2) coordiante system. Time-dependent; Vector (ndim1,ndim2)

field.name: pow_den
field.documentation: Source power density. Here sum(M,N=1,2; pow_den*gNM*dimN*dimM) have unit [W]. Time-dependent; Vector (ndim1,ndim2)

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Matrix

field.name: abserror
field.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Matrix

field.name: relerror
field.documentation: Relative error on signal (normalised to signal value); Time-dependent; Matrix

field.name: src_rate
field.documentation: Source density of particles.Here sum(M,N=1,2; src_rate*gNM*dimN*dimM) have unit [1/s]. Time-dependent; Vector (ndim1,ndim2)

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Matrix

field.name: abserror
field.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Matrix

field.name: relerror
field.documentation: Relative error on signal (normalised to signal value); Time-dependent; Matrix

field.name: source_grid
field.documentation: Source density of particles in phase space (real space, velocity space, spin state).

field.name: grid_info
field.documentation: Specifying the grid; type of the grid (unstructured/structured/rectangular), the grid coordiante, in what variables the source is continuous/discrete, if the source is given at gyrocentre or real particle position.

field.name: grid_type
field.documentation: Type of grid in continuous dimensions: 1=unstructured grid, 2=structured non-rectangular grid, 3=rectangular. For rectangular grids, and/or dimensions with discrete source, the grid coordinates dim1,dim2,... is stored in vectors dim1(1:ndim1,1,1,1), dim1(1,1:ndim2,1,1),...

field.name: ngriddim
field.documentation: Number of grid dimension. For ngriddim=2 the grid is specified by dim1 and dim2 only, while dim3, dim4, dim5, and dim6 can be ignored (should not be allocated). For ngriddim=3 also dim3 is used to describe the grid etc. E.g. if your distribution is given by the three variables the poloidal flux, perpendicular and parallel velocities, then ngriddim=3 and grid_coord(1)=15, grid_coord(1)=16, grid_coord(3)=6.

field.name: grid_coord
field.documentation: Identifies the coordinates specifies in dim1, dim2, dim3, dim4, dim5, and dim6. grid_coord(K) describe the coordinate represented in dimK, for K=1,2...6. The possible coordinates are: 1=R, Major radius [m]; 2=Z, Vertical position [m]; 3=X, first cartesian coordinate in the horizontal plane [m]; 4=Y, second cartesian coordinate in the horizontal plane (grad(X) x grad(Y) = grad(Z)) [m]; 5=phi, toroidal angle [rad]; 6=psi, poloidal magnetic flux [T/m^2]; 7=rhotor, the square root of the toroidal flux; 8=theta, geometrical poloidal angle [rad]; 9=theta_b, Boozer poloidal angle [rad]; 10=vx, velocity in the x-direction [m/s]; 11=vy, velocity in the y-direction [m/s]; 12=vz, velocity in the z-direction [m/s]; 13=vel, total velocity [m/s]; 14=vphi, velocity in the phi-direction [m/s]; 15=vpar, velocity in the parallel direction [m/s]; 16=vperp, velocity in the perpendicular direction [m/s]; 17=E, Hamiltonian energy [J]; 18=Pphi, canonical toroidal angular momentum [kg m^2/s]; 19=mu, magnetic moment [J/T]; 20=Lambda=mu/E [1/T]; 21=pitch=vpar/v [-]; 22=s, the position of the omnigenous plane (generalised equitorial plane) as described by the fields omnigen_surf%s and omnigen_surf%rz; 23=particle spin; 24=n_Legendre, the index of the Legendre polynomial of the pitch, e.g. if the k:th component of dim3(1,1,k,1,1,1)=5 then this refer to the 5:th Legendre polynomial P_5(xi). Vector (6)

field.name: discrete_dims
field.documentation: Specifies discrete or continuous grid in each dimension separately. For discrete_dims(K)=1, K=1,2...6: the source is discretely distributed at the grid points of the dimK-grid (e.g. to treat the discrete energies injected with NBI); for discrete_dims(K)=0: continuous source, i.e. the source is distributed over the continuous variable dimK (e.g. the source density is a continuous function of the major radius). Vector (6)

field.name: gyrosrc_type
field.documentation: Defines how to interpret the source: 1 = the source is calulated at the particle birth point; 2 = the source is calulated at the gyro centre of the birth point.

field.name: dim1
field.documentation: Grid in the first dimension in phase space (as specified in grid_coord). Time-dependent; Array6d (ndim1, ndim2, ndim3, ndim4, ndim5, ndim6)

field.name: dim2
field.documentation: Grid in the second dimension in phase space (as specified in grid_coord). Time-dependent; Array6d (ndim1, ndim2, ndim3, ndim4, ndim5, ndim6)

field.name: dim3
field.documentation: Grid in the third dimension in phase space (as specified in grid_coord). Time-dependent; Array6d (ndim1, ndim2, ndim3, ndim4, ndim5, ndim6)

field.name: dim4
field.documentation: Grid in the fourth dimension in phase space (as specified in grid_coord). Time-dependent; Array6d (ndim1, ndim2, ndim3, ndim4, ndim5, ndim6)

field.name: dim5
field.documentation: Grid in the fifth dimension in phase space (as specified in grid_coord). Time-dependent; Array6d (ndim1, ndim2, ndim3, ndim4, ndim5, ndim6)

field.name: dim6
field.documentation: Grid in the sixth dimension in phase space (as specified in grid_coord). Time-dependent; Array6d (ndim1, ndim2, ndim3, ndim4, ndim5, ndim6)

field.name: jacobian
field.documentation: Jacobian of the phase space grid coordinate system specified in grid_coord. Time-dependent; Array6d (ndim1, ndim2, ndim3, ndim4, ndim5, ndim6)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source rate of particles in phase space. The units depend on the grid_type: [m^-3 s^-1] if the grid is discrete in energy/velocity and [(m/s)^-3 m^-3 s^-1] if continuous. Time-dependent; Array6d (ndim1, ndim2, ndim3, ndim4, ndim5, ndim6)

field.name: source_mark
field.documentation: Source given as a set of markers (test particles)

field.name: var_coord
field.documentation: Identifies the coordinates specifies in var1, var2, var3, var4, var5, var6 and var7. var_coord(K) describe the coordinate represented in varK, for K=1,2...7. The possible coordinates are: 1=R, Major radius [m]; 2=Z, Vertical position [m]; 3=X, first cartesian coordinate in the horizontal plane [m]; 4=Y, second cartesian coordinate in the horizontal plane (grad(X) x grad(Y) = grad(Z)) [m]; 5=phi, toroidal angle [rad]; 6=psi, poloidal magnetic flux [T/m^2]; 7=rhotor, the square root of the toroidal flux; 8=theta, geometrical poloidal angle [rad]; 9=theta_b, Boozer poloidal angle [rad]; 10=vx, velocity in the x-direction [m/s]; 11=vy, velocity in the y-direction [m/s]; 12=vz, velocity in the z-direction [m/s]; 13=vel, total velocity [m/s]; 14=vphi, velocity in the phi-direction [m/s]; 15=vpar, velocity in the parallel direction [m/s]; 16=vperp, velocity in the perpendicular direction [m/s]; 17=E, Hamiltonian energy [J]; 18=Pphi, canonical toroidal angular momentum [kg m^2/s]; 19=mu, magnetic moment [J/T]; 20=Lambda=mu/E [1/T]; 21=pitch=vpar/v [-]; 22=s, the position of the omnigenous plane (generalised equitorial plane) as described by the fields omnigen_surf%s and omnigen_surf%rz; 23=particle spin. Vector (7)

field.name: gyrosrc_type
field.documentation: Defines how to interpret the source: 1 = the source is calulated at the particle birth point; 2 = the source is calulated at the gyro centre of the birth point.

field.name: var1
field.documentation: Phase space variable number one characterising the markers. Time-dependent; Vector (n_particles)

field.name: var2
field.documentation: Phase space variable number two characterising the markers. Time-dependent; Vector (n_particles)

field.name: var3
field.documentation: Phase space variable number three characterising the markers. Time-dependent; Vector (n_particles)

field.name: var4
field.documentation: Phase space variable number four characterising the markers. Time-dependent; Vector (n_particles)

field.name: var5
field.documentation: Phase space variable number five characterising the markers. Time-dependent; Vector (n_particles)

field.name: var6
field.documentation: Phase space variable number six characterising the markers. Time-dependent; Vector (n_particles)

field.name: var7
field.documentation: Phase space variable number seven characterising the markers. Time-dependent; Vector (n_particles)

field.name: weight
field.documentation: Weight of the markers; Time-dependent; Vector (n_particles)

field.name: coordtype
field.documentation: Type of coordinates describing the physical space. Vector(nspacedim); The size of coordtype defines the dimension of the space.; For predefined integer constants for standard coordinates see; the documentation of the grid service library.

field.name: properties
field.documentation: Space properties.

field.name: geotype
field.documentation: Type of space geometry (id flag). A flag defining how the geometry (geo) fields associated with; grid nodes and objects are to be interpreted. If the field is undefined (0=GRID_UNDEFINED), the standard interpretation for; the given coordinate types is assumed.

field.name: geotypeid
field.documentation: Type of space geometry (id string). A string defining how the geometry (geo) fields associated with; grid nodes and objects are to be interpreted. If the field is undefined, the standard interpretation for; the given coordinate types is assumed.

field.name: objects
field.documentation: Definition of the higher-dimensional objects in the space.; Structure Array(1:nspacedim). First dimension: dimension of the objects (1=edges, 2=faces, 3=cells/volumes, etc...)

field.name: boundary
field.documentation: Lists of (n-1)-dimensional objects defining the boundary of an n-dimensional object. Matrix(nobject,nmaxobjectboundary);First dimension: object index, second index: boundary object index

field.name: neighbour
field.documentation: Connectivity information. 3d array of integers(nobject, nmaxobjectboundaries, nmaxneighboursperboundary).; Stores the indices of the n-dimensional objects adjacent to a given n-dimensional object.;An object can possibly have multiple neighbours on every boundary. ;First dimension: object index, second dimension: boundary index, third dimension: neighbour index on the boundary.

field.name: geo
field.documentation: Geometry data matrix associated with an object. 3d float array(nobject,ngeo1,ngeo2). Meaning depends on the value of grid_space.properties.geotype.; First dimension: object index, second+third dimension: matrix row+column.

field.name: measure
field.documentation: Measure of object, i.e. physical size (length for 1d, area for 2d, volume for 3d objects). [m^dim]. Use this field to store measures for (sub)objects explicitly defined in spaces.

field.name: nodes
field.documentation: Definition of the nodes in the space.

field.name: geo
field.documentation: Geometry data matrix associated with every node. 3d float array(nnodesinspace, ngeo1, ngeo2). Meaning depends on the value of grid_space.properties.geotype.; First dimension: object index, second+third dimension: matrix row+column.; In the default case (grid_space.properties.geotype=undefined), this field has dimensions (nnodeinspace,nspacedim,1) and simply holds the coordinates for every node, where nspacedim is the dimension of the space. The j-th component of the coordinate vector; of the i-th node is thus geo(i,j,1).

field.name: xpoints
field.documentation: List of indices of all nodes which are x-points. Vector(nxpoints)

field.name: altgeo
field.documentation: (Possibly multiple) alternative geometry information for nodes. Structure array(naltgeometries). Mainly intended for plotting.

field.name: coordtype
field.documentation: Coordinate axis types for alternate coordinate system. Vector(nspacedim).

field.name: geo
field.documentation: Alternate geometry data matrix associated with every node. 3d float array(nnodesinspace, ngeo1, ngeo2). See documentation of nodes.geo one level up.

field.name: alias
field.documentation: Alias list. Vector(nnodesinspace). If this vector is defined, it holds one entry per node. If an entry alias(i)=j with j != 0(=GRID_UNDEFINED),; this means that the nodes with index i and j are aliased, i.e. are identical. If alias(i)=0(=GRID_UNDEFINED), the; node is not aliased to another node. This mechanism can be used to indicate periodic boundaries.

field.name: subgrids
field.documentation: Definitions of subgrids. Structure array(nsubgrids).

field.name: id
field.documentation: ID string (name) of the subgrid. Freely chosen by user, possibly used for plotting.

field.name: list
field.documentation: List of object lists. Structure array(nobjectlists).

field.name: cls
field.documentation: Class tuple of the objects in the list. Vector(nspace)

field.name: indset
field.documentation: Index set for implicit definition of the object indices. List of indexlists. Structure Array(nspace)

field.name: range
field.documentation: Defines an index range enumerating from range[1] to range[2] (with both range[1] and range[2] included). Vector(2)

field.name: ind
field.documentation: An explicit list of indices. If this member is defined and has size>0, the list is assumed to be explicit. Vector(nindices)

field.name: ind
field.documentation: Explicit list of index tuples. Matrix(nobject, nspace). First dimension: object index, second dimension: index tuple index.; If this field is defined and has size > 0, the object list is understood to be explicit.

field.name: metric
field.documentation: Metric coefficients. Array of structures (nsubgrids). Metric information for every subgrid.

field.name: measure
field.documentation: Measure of object, i.e. physical size (length for 1d, area for 2d, volume for 3d objects). [m^dim]. Use this field to store measures of implicitly defined grid objects.

field.name: subgrid
field.documentation: Index of the subgrid (as stored in grid.subgrids) the data is stored on.

field.name: scalar
field.documentation: Scalar representation of data. One scalar entry is stored per object in the subgrid.; The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float Vector(nobjects_subgrid). First dimension: object index.

field.name: vector
field.documentation: Vector representation of data. One vector is stored per object in the subgrid. The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float matrix(nobjects_subgrid, ndata).First dimension: object index, second dimension: index of data vector.

field.name: matrix
field.documentation: Matrix representation of data. One matrix is stored per object in the subgrid. The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; 3d float array(nobjects_subgrid,ndata1,ndata2). First dimension: object index, second dimension: matrix row, third dimension: matrix column.

field.name: g11
field.documentation: Metric coefficients g11. Structure array(nsubgrid_coefficient)

field.name: zn

field.name: zmax

field.documentation: Scalar representation of data. One scalar entry is stored per object in the subgrid.; The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float Vector(nobjects_subgrid). First dimension: object index.

field.name: vector
field.documentation: Vector representation of data. One vector is stored per object in the subgrid. The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float matrix(nobjects_subgrid, ndata).First dimension: object index, second dimension: index of data vector.

field.name: matrix
field.documentation: Matrix representation of data. One matrix is stored per object in the subgrid. The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; 3d float array(nobjects_subgrid,ndata1,ndata2). First dimension: object index, second dimension: matrix row, third dimension: matrix column.

field.name: codeparam
field.documentation: Code parameters

field.name: codename
field.documentation: Name of the code

field.name: codeversion
field.documentation: Version of the code (as in the ITM repository)

field.name: parameters
field.documentation: List of the code specific parameters, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_diag
field.documentation: List of the code specific diagnostic/output, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_flag
field.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values meaning some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used. Exact rules could discussed and implemented in the module wrapper. Time-dependent.

field.name: time
field.documentation: Time [s]; Time-dependent; Scalar

CPO.documentation: Description of a 2D, axi-symmetric, tokamak equilibrium; result of an equilibrium code. Time-dependent CPO

field.name: datainfo
field.documentation: Generic information on a data item

field.name: dataprovider
field.documentation: Name of the actual data provider (the person who filled the data)

field.name: putdate
field.documentation: Date at which the data has been put in the DB

field.name: source
field.documentation: Exact reference of the data source (e.g. original reference in the native machine data base)

field.name: comment
field.documentation: Any additional comment

field.name: isref
field.documentation: 1 if the data can be found in the present data base entry; 2 if the data can be found in a parent data base entry; 0 if no data consistent with the present entry can be found.

field.name: whatref
field.documentation: Structure defining a database entry and the CPO occurrence

field.name: user
field.documentation: Name of the user if private data, public if public ITM database.

field.name: machine
field.documentation: Name of the device

field.name: shot
field.documentation: Shot number

field.name: run
field.documentation: Run number

field.name: occurrence
field.documentation: Occurrence number of the CPO in the reference entry

field.name: putinfo
field.documentation: Level 2 information describing how to retrieve the actual data for the UAL. Not to be filled/used by the ITM user !

field.name: putmethod
field.documentation: Storage method for this data

field.name: putaccess
field.documentation: Instructions to access the data using this method

field.name: putlocation
field.documentation: Name of this data under this method

field.name: rights
field.documentation: Access rights to this data

field.name: eqconstraint
field.documentation: measurements to constrain the equilibrium, output values and accuracy of the fit

field.name: bpol
field.documentation: poloidal pickup coils [T]

field.name: measured
field.documentation: Measured value of the signal; Time-dependent; Array(nmeas)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Path to the source signal (diagnostic or genprof, from which to read all info on the signal), e.g. 'magdiag/bpol_probes/measure/value'. String

field.name: time
field.documentation: Exact time slice used from the time array of the source signal. If the time slice does not exist in the time array of the source signal, it means linear interpolation has been used);Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: exact
field.documentation: 1 means exact data, is not fitted; 0 means the equilibrium code does a least square fit; Time-dependent; Array(nmeas)

field.name: weight
field.documentation: weight given to the measurement (>= 0); Time-dependent; Array(nmeas)

field.name: sigma
field.documentation: standard deviation of the measurement; Time-dependent; Array(nmeas)

field.name: calculated
field.documentation: Signal as recalculated by the equilibrium code; Time-dependent; Array(nmeas)

field.name: chi2
field.documentation: chi^2 of (calculated-measured); Time-dependent; Array(nmeas)

field.name: bvac_r
field.documentation: Vacuum field times radius in the toroidal field magnet [T.m];

field.name: measured
field.documentation: Measured value of the signal; Time-dependent; Scalar.

field.name: source
field.documentation: Path to the source signal (diagnostic or genprof, from which to read all info on the signal); String

field.name: time
field.documentation: Time (exact time slice used from the time array of the source signal. If the time slice does not exist in the time array of the source signal, it means linear interpolation has been used); Time-dependent; Scalar.

field.name: exact
field.documentation: 1 means exact data, is not fitted; 0 means the equilibrium code does a least square fit; scalar integer

field.name: weight
field.documentation: weight given to the measurement (>= 0); Time-dependent; Scalar.

field.name: sigma
field.documentation: standard deviation of the measurement; Time-dependent; Scalar.

field.name: calculated
field.documentation: Signal as recalculated by the equilibrium code; Time-dependent; Scalar.

field.name: chi2
field.documentation: chi^2 of (calculated-measured); Time-dependent; Scalar.

field.name: diamagflux
field.documentation: Diamagnetic flux [Wb], defined as integral (Btor - Btor,vac) dS where the integral is over the poloidal cross section of the plasma. It is measured by a single wire loop around the cross section of the torus (e.g. Wesson, Tokamaks, 1997, p.473). It gives information about the separation of the two source profiles p' and FF' of the Grad-Shafranov equation.

field.name: flush
field.documentation: FLUSH package coefficients for the mapping of the equlibrium. The time grid of this structure is the same as the equilibrium structure above.

field.name: datainfo
field.documentation: Generic information on a data item

field.name: dataprovider
field.documentation: Name of the actual data provider (the person who filled the data)

field.name: putdate
field.documentation: Date at which the data has been put in the DB

field.name: source
field.documentation: Exact reference of the data source (e.g. original reference in the native machine data base)

field.name: comment
field.documentation: Any additional comment

field.name: isref
field.documentation: 1 if the data can be found in the present data base entry; 2 if the data can be found in a parent data base entry; 0 if no data consistent with the present entry can be found.

field.name: whatref
field.documentation: Structure defining a database entry and the CPO occurrence

field.name: user
field.documentation: Name of the user if private data, public if public ITM database.

field.name: machine
field.documentation: Name of the device

field.name: shot
field.documentation: Shot number

field.name: run
field.documentation: Run number

field.name: occurrence
field.documentation: Occurrence number of the CPO in the reference entry

field.name: putinfo
field.documentation: Level 2 information describing how to retrieve the actual data for the UAL. Not to be filled/used by the ITM user !

field.name: putmethod
field.documentation: Storage method for this data

field.name: putaccess
field.documentation: Instructions to access the data using this method

field.name: putlocation
field.documentation: Name of this data under this method

field.name: rights
field.documentation: Access rights to this data

field.name: position
field.documentation: Major radius and altitude of the FLUSH grid [m]; Time-dependent; Vectors resp. (nR) and (nZ)

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: coef
field.documentation: Coefficients of the fit; Time-dependent; Matrix 2D (nR,nZ)

field.name: codeparam
field.documentation: Code parameters

field.name: codename
field.documentation: Name of the code

field.name: codeversion
field.documentation: Version of the code (as in the ITM repository)

field.name: parameters
field.documentation: List of the code specific parameters, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_diag
field.documentation: List of the code specific diagnostic/output, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_flag
field.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values meaning some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used. Exact rules could discussed and implemented in the module wrapper. Time-dependent.

field.name: global_param
field.documentation: 0d output parameters

field.name: beta_pol
field.documentation: poloidal beta; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: beta_tor
field.documentation: toroidal beta; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: beta_normal
field.documentation: normalised beta; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: i_plasma
field.documentation: total toroidal plasma current [A]; Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewed from above. Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: li
field.documentation: internal inductance; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: volume
field.documentation: total plasma volume [m^3]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: area
field.documentation: area poloidal cross section [m^2]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: psi_ax
field.documentation: poloidal flux at the magnetic axis [Wb]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: psi_bound
field.documentation: poloidal flux at the selected plasma boundary (separatrix for a free boundary code; fixed boundary for fixed boundary code) [Wb]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: mag_axis
field.documentation: Magnetic axis values

field.name: position
field.documentation: Position of the magnetic axis [m]; Time-dependent; Scalar;

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: bphi
field.documentation: Total toroidal magnetic field at the magnetic axis [T]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: q
field.documentation: q at the magnetic axis; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: q_95
field.documentation: q at the 95% poloidal flux surface; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: q_min
field.documentation: minimum q value in the plasma; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: toroid_field
field.documentation: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field, redundant with the toroidfield CPO, to be used by the ETS

field.name: r0
field.documentation: Characteristic major radius of the device (used in publications, usually middle of the vessel at the equatorial midplane) [m]. Scalar.

field.name: b0
field.documentation: Vacuum field at r0 [T]; Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewed from above. Scalar. Time-dependent.

field.name: w_mhd
field.documentation: Plasma energy content = 3/2 * int(p,dV) with p being the total pressure (thermal + fast particles) [J]. Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: gamma
field.documentation: Adiabatic index. Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: profiles_1d
field.documentation: output profiles as a function of the poloidal flux

field.name: psi
field.documentation: Poloidal flux [Wb], without 1/2pi and such that Bp=|grad psi| /R/2/pi. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: phi
field.documentation: toroidal flux [Wb]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: pressure
field.documentation: pressure profile as a function of the poloidal flux [Pa]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: F_dia
field.documentation: diamagnetic profile (R B_phi) [T m]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: pprime
field.documentation: psi derivative of the pressure profile [Pa/Wb]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: ffprime
field.documentation: psi derivative of F_dia multiplied with F_dia [T^2 m^2/Wb]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: jphi
field.documentation: flux surface averaged toroidal current density = average(jphi/R) / average(1/R) [A/m^2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: jparallel
field.documentation: flux surface averaged parallel current density = average(j.B) / B0, where B0 = equilibrium/global_param/toroid_field/b0 ; [A/m^2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: q
field.documentation: Safety factor = dphi/dpsi [-]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: r_inboard
field.documentation: radial coordinate (major radius) at the height and on the left of the magnetic axis [m]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: r_outboard
field.documentation: radial coordinate (major radius) at the height and on the right of the magnetic axis [m]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: rho_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate [m], to be used by the ETS and in many CPOs (coreprof, ...). Defined as sqrt(phi/pi/B0), where B0 = equilibrium/global_param/toroid_field/b0. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: dpsidrho_tor
field.documentation: dpsi/drho_tor [Wb/m]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: rho_vol
field.documentation: Normalised radial coordinate related to the plasma volume. Defined as sqrt(volume / volume[LCFS]). Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: beta_pol
field.documentation: poloidal beta (inside the magnetic surface); Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: li
field.documentation: internal inductance (inside the magnetic surface); Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: elongation
field.documentation: Elongation; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: tria_upper
field.documentation: Upper triangularity profile; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: tria_lower
field.documentation: Lower triangularity profile; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: volume
field.documentation: Volume enclosed in the flux surface [m^3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: vprime
field.documentation: Radial derivative of the volume enclosed in the flux surface with respect to psi, i.e. dV/dpsi [m^3/Wb]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: area
field.documentation: Cross-sectional area of the flux surface [m^2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: aprime
field.documentation: Radial derivative of the cross-sectional area of the flux surface with respect to psi, i.e. darea/dpsi [m^2/Wb]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: surface
field.documentation: Surface area of the flux surface [m^2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: ftrap
field.documentation: Trapped particle fraction; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: gm1
field.documentation: average(1/R^2); Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: gm2
field.documentation: average(grad_rho^2/R^2); Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: gm3
field.documentation: average(grad_rho^2); Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: gm4
field.documentation: average(1/B^2) [T^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: gm5
field.documentation: average(B^2) [T^2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: gm6
field.documentation: average(grad_rho^2/B^2) [T^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: gm7
field.documentation: average(grad_rho); Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: gm8
field.documentation: average(R); Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: gm9
field.documentation: average(1/R); Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: b_av
field.documentation: average(B); Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: b_min
field.documentation: minimum(B) on the flux surface; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: b_max
field.documentation: maximum(B) on the flux surface; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: omega
field.documentation: Toroidal rotation angular frequency (assumed constant on the flux surface) [rad/s]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: omegaprime
field.documentation: Psi derivative of the toroidal rotation angular frequency (assumed constant on the flux surface) [rad/(s.Wb)]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: mach_a
field.documentation: Alfvenic Mach number; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: phi_flow
field.documentation: Poloidal flow function phi_flow = rho*v_pol*B_pol[kg/(V.s^2)]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: s_flow
field.documentation: Definition to be provided; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: h_flow
field.documentation: flow function h_flow = gamma/(gamma-1)*s_flow*rho^(gamma-1) + 0.5*(phi_flow*B/rho)^2 - 0.5*(R*omega)^2 [m^2/s^2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: profiles_2d
field.documentation: output profiles in the poloidal plane

field.name: grid_type
field.documentation: Selection of one of a set of grid types. 1-rectangular (R,Z) grid, in this case the position arrays should not be filled since they are redundant with grid/dim1 and dim2.

field.name: grid
field.documentation: definition of the 2D grid

field.name: dim1
field.documentation: First dimension values; Time-dependent; Vector (ndim1)

field.name: dim2
field.documentation: Second dimension values; Time-dependent; Vector (ndim2)

field.name: connect
field.documentation: In case of a finite elemnt representation, lists the points (3 for triangles, 4 for quadrangles) which define a finite element. In this case, ndim1=ndim2 and the value of grid_connect represents the index of the points in the list 1:ndim. E.g. : grid_connect(i,1:4) is a list of four integers [k1 k2 k3 k4] meaning that finite element #i is defined by the points (dim1(k1),dim2(k1)),(dim1(k2),dim2(k2)),(dim1(k3),dim2(k3)) and (dim1(k4),dim2(k4)); Time-dependent; Matrix of integers (nelement,4)

field.name: r
field.documentation: values of the major radius on the grid [m]; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: z
field.documentation: values of the altitude on the grid [m]; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: psi
field.documentation: values of the poloidal flux at the grid in the poloidal plane [Wb]; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: theta
field.documentation: values of the poloidal angle on the grid [rad]; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: jphi
field.documentation: toroidal plasma current density [A m-2]; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: jpar
field.documentation: parallel (to magnetic field) plasma current density [A m-2]; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: br
field.documentation: R component of the poloidal magnetic field at the specified grid [T]; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: bz
field.documentation: Z component of the poloidal magnetic field at the specified grid [T]; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: bphi
field.documentation: toroidal component of the magnetic field at the specified grid [T]; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: vphi
field.documentation: toroidal flow velocity [m/s]; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: vtheta
field.documentation: Poloidal flow velocity [m/s]; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: rho_mass
field.documentation: Mass density [kg/m^3]; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: pressure
field.documentation: Pressure [Pa]; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: temperature
field.documentation: Temperature [eV]; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: coord_sys
field.documentation: flux surface coordinate system on a square grid of flux and angle

field.name: grid_type
field.documentation: Type of coordinate system

field.name: grid
field.documentation: Regular grid definition; Time-dependent

field.name: dim1
field.documentation: First dimension values; Vector (ndim1)

field.name: dim2
field.documentation: Second dimension values; Vector (ndim2)

field.name: jacobian
field.documentation: Jacobian of the coordinate system; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: g_11
field.documentation: metric coefficients g_11; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: g_12
field.documentation: metric coefficients g_12; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: g_13
field.documentation: metric coefficients g_13; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: g_22
field.documentation: metric coefficients g_22; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: g_23
field.documentation: metric coefficients g_23; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: g_33
field.documentation: metric coefficients g_33; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: position
field.documentation: R and Z position of grid points; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: output_diag
field.documentation: List of the code specific diagnostic/output, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_flag
field.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values meaning some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used. Exact rules could discussed and implemented in the module wrapper. Time-dependent.

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source. Time-dependent. Structure array. Replicate this source structure for each neutron or gamma with a particular energy.

field.name: fus_product
field.documentation: Type of fusion product (neutron,gamma)

field.name: reaction
field.documentation: Type of reaction involved (e.g. DD neutron, Be-alpha,n,gamma-C)

field.name: counts
field.documentation: Integrated emissivity [m^-2.s^-1].

field.name: expression
field.documentation: Formal expression for the line integral to be evaluated as a function of the involved physical quantities

field.documentation: Geometric description of the lines of sight

field.name: pivot_point
field.documentation: Pivot point of each line of sight; Vector (nchords)

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: phi
field.documentation: Toroidal angle [rad]

field.name: horchordang1
field.documentation: Angle [rad] of horizontal projection of l.o.s. with poloidal cross section (0 for HFS to LFS chord - see Convention_angles_interfdiag.pdf) [rad]. Vector (nchords)

field.name: verchordang1
field.documentation: Angle of chord with vertical axis (0 for bottom-top chord, Pi for top-bottom chord - see Convention_angles_interfdiag.pdf) [rad]; Vector (nchords)

field.name: width
field.documentation: Width of the laser beam (1/e) [m]; Vector (nchords)

field.name: second_point
field.documentation: Second point defining the line of sight together with the pivot_point. In case the probing wave is reflected, this should be the position of the mirror. This data is redundant with horchordang1 and verchordang1. Vector (nchords).

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: phi
field.documentation: Toroidal angle [rad]

field.name: horchordang2
field.documentation: For reflected l.o.s. only (undefined otherwise) : Angle [rad] of horizontal projection of reflected l.o.s. with poloidal cross section (0 for HFS to LFS chord - see Convention_angles_interfdiag.pdf) [rad]. Vector (nchords)

field.name: verchordang2
field.documentation: For reflected l.o.s. only (undefined otherwise) : Angle of reflected chord with vertical axis (0 for bottom-top chord, Pi for top-bottom chord - see Convention_angles_interfdiag.pdf) [rad]; Vector (nchords)

field.name: third_point
field.documentation: Third point defining the reflected line of sight together with the second_point (undefined if the probing wave is not reflected). This data is redundant with horchordang2 and verchordang2. Vector (nchords).

field.name: putdate
field.documentation: Date at which the data has been put in the DB

field.name: source
field.documentation: Exact reference of the data source (e.g. original reference in the native machine data base)

field.name: comment
field.documentation: Any additional comment

field.name: isref
field.documentation: 1 if the data can be found in the present data base entry; 2 if the data can be found in a parent data base entry; 0 if no data consistent with the present entry can be found.

field.documentation: Structure defining a database entry and the CPO occurrence

field.name: user
field.documentation: Name of the user if private data, public if public ITM database.

field.documentation: Name of the device

field.documentation: Shot number

field.documentation: Run number

field.name: setup_inject
field.documentation: Detailed information on an injection unit.

field.name: position
field.documentation: Position of centre of injection unit surface.

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: phi
field.documentation: Toroidal angle [rad]

field.name: tang_rad
field.documentation: Tagency radius (major radius where the central line of a NBI unit is tangent to a circle around the torus) [m]

field.name: angle
field.documentation: Angle of inclination between a line at the centre of the injection unit surface and the horiontal plane [rad]

field.name: direction
field.documentation: Direction of the beam seen from above the torus: -1 = clockwise; 1 = counter clockwise

field.name: focal_len_hz
field.documentation: Horizontal focal length along the beam line [m]

field.name: focal_len_vc
field.documentation: Vertical focal length along the beam line [m]

field.name: divergence
field.documentation: Detailed information on beamlet divergence. Divergens is described as a super position of Gaussian profiles with amplitide "frac_divcomp" and vertical/horizontal divergence "div_vert"/"div_horiz". Note that for positive ion NBI the divergence is well described by a single Gaussian.

field.name: frac_divcomp
field.documentation: Fraction of injected particles. Vector(ndiv_comp)

field.name: div_vert
field.documentation: Beam divergence for a unit in the vertical direction[rad]. Vector(ndiv_comp)

field.name: div_horiz
field.documentation: Beam divergence for a unit in the horizontal direction[rad]. Vector(ndiv_comp)

field.name: beamlets
field.documentation: Detailed information on beamlets.

field.name: position
field.documentation: Position of beamlets. Vector rzphi1D (nbeamlets)

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: phi
field.documentation: Toroidal angle [rad]

field.name: tang_rad_blt
field.documentation: Tangency radius (major radius where the central line of a beamlet is tangent to a circle around the torus) [m]; Vector(nbeamlets)

field.name: angle_blt
field.documentation: Angle of inclination between a line at the centre of a beamlet and the horiontal plane [rad]; Vector(nbeamlets)

field.name: pow_frc_blt
field.documentation: Fraction of power of a unit injected by a beamlet; Vector(nbeamlets)

field.documentation: Name of the code

field.documentation: Version of the code (as in the ITM repository)

field.documentation: List of the code specific parameters, string expected to be in XML format.

field.documentation: List of the code specific diagnostic/output, string expected to be in XML format.

field.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values meaning some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used. Exact rules could discussed and implemented in the module wrapper. Time-dependent.

field.name: rho_tor_norm
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal flux coordinate values (= rho_tor normalised to the value at the last grid point); Vector (nrho)

field.name: rho_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate (not normalised, equivalent to rho_tor_norm) [m]; Vector (nrho). Time-dependent.

field.name: composition
field.documentation: Plasma composition (description of ion species).

field.name: amn
field.documentation: Atomic mass number (lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: zn
field.documentation: Nuclear charge (lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: zion
field.documentation: Ion charge (of the dominant ionisation state; lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: imp_flag
field.documentation: Multiple charge state calculation flag : 0-Only one charge state is considered; 1-Multiple charge state are considered and are described in impurity CPO; Vector (nion)

field.name: ni_neo
field.documentation: Neoclassical transport coefficients for ion density equation. Time-dependent.

field.name: diff_eff
field.documentation: Effective diffusivity [m^2.s^-1]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: vconv_eff
field.documentation: Effective convection [m.s^-1]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: exchange
field.documentation: Ion to electron energy exchange [W.m^-3]. Time-dependent. Matrix(nrho,nion).

field.name: qgi
field.documentation: Energy exchange term due to transport. [W.m^-3]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: flux
field.unit: field.m.s^-1,.m^-3 if field is not a density itself
field.documentation: Flux. Not used in transport equations [field.m.s^-1,.m^-3 if field is not a density itself]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: off_diagonal
field.documentation: Details of the transport matrix, just for diagnostic (not used in transport equations). Time-dependent.

field.name: d_ni
field.documentation: Off-Diagonal term coupling ion density gradient to the transport equation [m.^2.s^-1]. Time-dependent. Array3d (nrho,nion,nion)

field.name: d_ti
field.documentation: Off-Diagonal term coupling ion density gradient to the transport equation [m.^2.s^-1]. Time-dependent. Array3d (nrho,nion,nion)

field.name: d_ne
field.documentation: Off-Diagonal term coupling electron density gradient to the transport equation [m.^2.s^-1]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: d_te
field.documentation: Off-Diagonal term coupling electron temperature gradient to the transport equation [m.^2.s^-1]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: d_epar
field.documentation: Off-Diagonal term coupling parallel electric field to the transport equation [m.^2.s^-1]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: d_mtor
field.documentation: Off-Diagonal term coupling total toroidal momentum to the transport equation [m.^2.s^-1]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Flag describing the form of transport produced by the original model : 0- not calculated, 1- D and V, 2- flux, 3- full transport matrix. Scalar.
